**üìÖ NS Events for March 8, 2025** (4 events)

**Daily Mental Reset (Morning) - Aum (Om) Chants** [‚Üó](https://lu.ma/wnkodk3e)
10:00 AM - 10:30 AM | Swimming Pool Area - Level 1 | By Kritika & Network School

**Hackathon ‚Ññ 1 | AI-Empowered** [‚Üó](https://lu.ma/auifgm9n)

@everyone **The first NS Hackathon starts at 12pm tomorrow in the Ping Pong Room** üíª 

Hackathons used to be reserved for hardcore computer scientists and engineers ‚Äî but not anymore. The rise of generative AI is changing the game and ushering in the era of the *vibe-coder*. üèÑ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è üë®‚Äçüíª ‚ú® It doesn‚Äôt matter if you're a beginner or a cracked 100x engineer ‚Äî tools like Cursor, Replit, Windsurf, and Lovable can help you go from idea to MVP in just a few hours.

Sign up [here](https://lu.ma/auifgm9n) and reach out to @undefined @undefined for any logistical questions.

The NS Core team will be judging. And the winning team walks away with [Nucleus DNA tests](https://mynucleus.com/product). üèÜ

**Friday**
- 7a Starship flight watch party (Ping Pong Room)
- 7:30a Volleyball practice (coordinates are in the Luma event https://lu.ma/sxdd5hqx)
- 9a Join NS on Strava

- 4p Unlocking China Part 1 of 4 (Coworking)
- 5p Junto: History as Trajectory (FULL)
- 6p Poker Night (Ping Pong)
- 7p Friday Drinks (Talk to @undefined for location) 
- 8:30 Vipassana meditation (Talk to Andy for the location)

**Saturday**
12p-6p The first ever hackathon at NS! 
7:30p Tarot Reading on the Beach

(Side note - let me know if you have a script that can help automate these kinds of messages. Bonus points if you can build this without needing Discord admin access or oversight from a team member to make it.  Scope would be to scan Lu.ma/ns for the day's events at 11:59pm every night and then send a message with something resembling the above format, ie. [TIME],[EVENT NAME],[LOCATION][LUMA LINK])

@everyone **Poker Tournament at 6pm tonight** 

The first poker tournament of this cohort will be at 6pm in the Ping Pong Room ‚Äî¬†hosted by @undefined.

In addition to the cash prize from the entry fees, the winner will also get a [Nucleus DNA test](<https://mynucleus.com/product>) worth $399! üß¨

Sign up here: https://lu.ma/qkwng46x.
@here Use code #nsmar6 on [sli.do](https://app.sli.do/event/a5ZjosarpZRD4ztTkHXfwW) to ask questions for today's talk.
Btw, here are some images of the new  [ns.com/profile](https://ns.com/profile) (which gets updated as you complete quizzes) and [ns.com/learn](https://ns.com/learn) (with the book list).

@everyone **The Network School Book Club**
The Network School Book Club is now live at ns.com/learn! Here‚Äôs how it works:

1) _Read books at ns.com/learn._ There‚Äôs a weekly list of books at ns.com/learn, all on various aspects of building startup societies, with links to get them on Amazon.

2) _Discuss books on Tuesday afternoon._ Each week, we‚Äôll hold a book club in the NS Cafe right before dinner time on Tuesday from 4-6pm. The first hour prior to dinner will be silent reading, and the second hour will be live discussion, which you can continue during dinner at 6pm. We‚Äôll group you for book club as we did for the mixer.

3) _Optionally, quiz and Warpcast review._ Each book has an optional quiz to self-test your understanding and get an NFT for your ns.com/profile. For extra credit, write a book review (whether full post or tweet length) and post it from your warpcast.com account.

**The First Three NS Books**
Most books on our list relate to startup societies, but the first week's curriculum is focused on self-improvement:

a) _Atomic Habits_ is James Clear‚Äôs guide to programming yourself
b) _Navalmanack_ is my friend Naval‚Äôs guide to building wealth
c) And _Tools of Titans_ is Tim Ferriss‚Äôs collection of successful heuristics from the successful

Why assign these three first? We're front-loading these three in particular so you can keep going back to them in the weeks/months that follow to keep getting value out of them. These types of books generate compound interest. Think of this as the "win" part of "win-and-help-win", the individual self-improvement part that's a daily part of the Network School Curriculum.

**Next Steps**
OK. As next steps, all you have to do is:

a) get the books on Kindle via [ns.com/learn](https://ns.com/learn) and 
b) sign up for the first book club from 4-6pm on Tuesday via [lu.ma/61pn7tfw](https://lu.ma/61pn7tfw)

We'll assign groups like for the mixer prior to Tuesday at 4pm. See you then!

**Talk by Network School co-founder Donovan Sung**

@everyone Tomorrow at 1:30pm in NS Coworking we'll have a talk by Donovan. He'll share stories from his time at YouTube (~$400B), Spotify ($100B), and Xiaomi ($200B) working at three hectocorn companies across three continents. 

Donovan will be sharing unfiltered insights and personal experiences, so this session will be off-the-record with no photography/videography allowed.

See you at NS Coworking: https://lu.ma/v0cnzbg9.

@everyone The NS Content Studio is open for businessüé• üé¨

The studio is located on the 3rd floor of the South Tower. It‚Äôs equipped with tripods, studio lights, a microphone, acoustic sound panels, high-speed WiFi, and phone tripod adapters. You can also bring additional personal equipment. Additionally, I have my own DSLR that you can use if you ask nicely üôÇ 

You can reserve the content studio for 30 minutes at a time at cal.com/nscontentstudio for up to four consecutive slots (2 hours). Please do not book the content studio as a phone booth for regular meetings.

Can't wait to see what everyone makes!

**Network School Content**

@undefined, @undefined, and many other NS members have been creating awesome content. 

Check out their üî• Reels [here](<https://www.instagram.com/reel/DGtRGeBSV6I/>) and [here](<https://www.instagram.com/p/DGx8JvsP2M9/>) showing day in the life of a Network School member. 

If you have high quality photos and videos from your time at the Network School, please upload them to this Google Drive: <https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1t5g-kQvQXYDfiM6rKUHjdFIqcbC6ndjU?usp=sharing>.

Hey @everyone! [here's](https://discord.com/channels/900827411917201418/1278081837780041749/1345597613944340512) a quick food update from @undefined who's taking care of NS Food üçΩÔ∏è We'll have 3 meals every day that are included in the NS membership:

- Lunch üç±: Served in grab-n-go boxes at 11:30am along with nutty puddings on level 13.

Feel free to check in with Jasmine if you have any questions or feedback! üòä
Or just click on this [link](https://app.sli.do/event/r8rSBuckaA49y5ACrSYCNF/login?clusterId=eu1&redirect_url=https://app.sli.do/event/r8rSBuckaA49y5ACrSYCNF).

Great seeing @everyone getting their Burn in at the gym today üî• Don't forget to claim your proof-of-workout by scanning the QR code on the TV after your Burn session. 

If you didn't get your welcome bags yesterday, come to NS Cafe on level 2. I'll be here till 12:30. 

**The opening address by Balaji will be at 1pm at [NS Coworking](https://maps.app.goo.gl/KwyHqDZ8q6xiFeGx5). **

@undefined and I will lead a walk to NS Coworking from the the lobby at 12:40.

Great first day @everyone . Awesome to meet many of you and can't wait to have more substantive chats in 1:1/small group settings.

Here's the schedule for tomorrow:
- Breakfast is served every day from 7a-10a on Floor 1 of the North Tower
- First burn classes of the year at 8, 9, 10, and 11am with @undefined . Please secure a spot at cal.com/ns/burn
- Lunch boxes and nutty puddings are usually made available to go around 11:30am/noon on Floor 13.
- @undefined will be available in the NS Cafe (the main lobby cafe) starting from 11:30am - 12:30pm to give folks their welcome packages (SIM cards, t-shirts, bags).
- Yash will then lead a walk from the hotel to NS Coworking at 12:35pm (you don't have to wait for him if you want to try doing the 15 minute walk on your own. Directions are below).
- @undefined will give his opening address at 1PM at NS Coworking. Please don't be late.
- For those who missed them, Sam and I will lead make up NS Combine sessions beginning at 3:30 PM. Sign up at cal.com/ns/combine . This will be the last combine until April 1. 
- For those who missed it today, we'll give another logistics orientation overview in 1215 at 6:15. You do not need to come again if you already came to the orientation today. 
- From now on, dinner will always be served at 6pm and will be available for two hours. 


When you walk to coworking, there are two ways to get there:
1) There is the way on the street, which Google Maps can tell you if you search "Network School"
2) There is another way to walk there which takes 2 minutes longer but is much more pleasant. It's a little complicated but very nice and free from cars. There is a guide here: https://youtube.com/shorts/aUC6Rwx5IO8?feature=shared

Get some good sleep. Start good habits now üôÇ

The combine is in the gym on the third floor of the South Tower. When you exit the elevators it's to your left. 

See the first batch there soon!

@everyone once you check-in at NS Lobby, head up to the 13th floor to grab lunch. 

Vegan bowls on the left ü´ë, meat bowls on the right ü•©, and nutty puddings at the bottom<:nutty_pudding:1275475283201233047>.
For the bus folks, I‚Äôm at the T1 bus stand near MaMum to go. Look for the white hair and black shirt.

@everyone A few quick to-dos for the first day of Network School üè´ 

1) **Check group details** ü§ù 

You should be in a channel with your group lead. Make sure you've friended your group lead on Discord. They are your point of contact on the NS Core team and can help with any queries. If you don't a see group channel, DM me @undefined and I'll get you added to the right group. 

- <#1344208833064603678>:¬†Justin 
- <#1344208954414075905>: Jackson 
- <#1344209034454241301>: Sam 
- <#1344209082155929650>: Yash 

2) **Sign up for fitness measurements and daily workouts** üí™

Sign up for [NS Combine](https://cal.com/ns/combine?month=2025-03) to measure your baseline fitness. Then pick a slot for your [daily workouts](https://cal.com/ns/burn). The workouts will be accessible to all so don't worry if you haven't been to the gym in a while ‚Äî¬†@undefined will help you get started on your fitness journey.

3) **Review the orientation guide** üìí 

Take a look at the orientation guide at [ns.com/wiki](https://ns.com/wiki). It has information to help you get settled in. We'll update the wiki periodically to answer FAQs. 

See y'all soon in just a few hours!

@everyone Network School v2 kicks off in just a few days!

Here's the schedule for March 1 by the hour:

- 11am: Check-in with NS staff at Changi Airport if opting for group transport by DMing @undefined
- 12pm: Depart for Network School with the bus
- 2pm: Arrive at Forest City Marina Hotel, check-in to your rooms, relax for a bit (NS Lobby)
- 3pm: Measure baseline fitness at the NS Combine ‚Äî sign up for a slot between 3-5:30pm [here](https://cal.com/ns/combine?month=2025-03) (NS Gym 3)
- 6pm: Learn how to make the most of your NS experience (Room 1215)
- 7pm: Enjoy healthy dinner (NS Cafe 13)

The opening address will be at 1pm on March 2 at [NS Coworking](https://maps.app.goo.gl/sKdrVb4ZHKmVaiqo7). 
The NS core team has been working hard to upgrade the facilities for v2.
We're looking forward to welcoming you!

Hi @everyone

If you answered "yes" to our [poll](https://discord.com/channels/900827411917201418/1278081815139188817/1339949766552850584) about needing a bus from Changi Airport to Forest City on March 1 at 12pm, then this message is confirmation that you have secured a free seat on the bus.

**In order to board the bus, you MUST complete the following steps:**
1) Send me a message ASAP on Whatsapp +1 (919) 491 1947 with your name and Discord handle. 
2) Fill out the onboarding form that has been emailed to you
3) Bring your passport
4) Complete the [Malaysia Digital Arrival Card](https://imigresen-online.imi.gov.my/mdac/main), which you will be able to do beginning tomorrow. Our bus number is PD206M when the form asks you.
5) Respond in [this thread](https://discord.com/channels/900827411917201418/1284425829387862087/1342733437466841118) if you need additional documents to enter Malaysia (based on your passport)

Once you've done all that, meet me at the [T1 Coach Stand](https://maps.app.goo.gl/FdTcZNPVNBoHRjSp9?g_st=aw) no later than 11:45am on March 1 (come a little earlier if you can). I'll be wearing a black NS.com t-shirt and am the palest person in Asia, so you can't miss me!

So excited to meet you all and start the v2 year off strong üòé

If you did not fill out the poll prior to this message, there MIGHT still be space on the bus for you. You must message me on WhatsApp to find out. Spots will be allocated allowed on a first-come, first-served basis.

@everyone please complete the requirements below to ensure smooth travel to the Network School. Excited to see everyone irl in a week!  

1) üì© **NS Onboarding**. We emailed all confirmed admits an onboarding form link. Complete this form at the earliest so we can prepare for your arrival. 

2) üöå **Group Transport**. Complete this [poll](https://discord.com/channels/900827411917201418/1278081815139188817/1339949766552850584) if you plan to join the group transport from Changi Airport to Network School on March 1 at 12pm. You must submit the onboarding form to be able to check-in to the bus. 

3) üá∏üá¨ **Singapore Arrival Card**. If you are transiting via Singapore, complete the [Singapore Digital Arrival Card](https://eservices.ica.gov.sg/sgarrivalcard/) within 3 days of your planned entry into Singapore. You must also ensure that you meet the [entry requirements](https://www.passportindex.org/country/singapore/) and have a Singapore visa if necessary based on your passport.

4) üá≤üáæ **Malaysia Arrival Card**. All members must complete the [Malaysia Digital Arrival Card](https://imigresen-online.imi.gov.my/mdac/main) within 3 days of your planned entry into Malaysia. You must also ensure that you meet the [entry requirements](https://www.passportindex.org/country/malaysia/) and have a Malaysia visa if necessary based on your passport. Note: 99% of the world can enter Malaysia visa-free but everyone is still required to submit the arrival card. 

5) üìú **Additional Documents**. Check with online resources and your local Malaysian embassy If you require additional documents to enter Malaysia. Some nationalities may require hotel booking and/or invitation letter. Respond in this [thread](https://discord.com/channels/900827411917201418/1279113199509180447/1279113200662610018) if you need these documents. 

6) üé´ **Return Tickets**. We recommend having a copy of your return tickets handy. Malaysian Immigration asks for return tickets and additional documents only some times (depending on the port of entry and the officer) but you may be denied entry if you can't provide them. Some websites and airlines that allow booking fully refundable tickets if you want to keep your travel plans flexible. 

7) üõÇ **Digital Nomad Visa**. If you're planning to stay at the Network School long term, learn about the Malaysia Digital Nomad Visa and start your application soon because it may take up to 8 weeks to hear back. More information in the [Network School Wiki](https://ns.com/wiki). 

Finally, as you get ready for the Network School, turn on notifications for ‚Å†the <#1284425829387862087> channel to stay in the loop üîî And as always, DM me @undefined or @undefined if you have any private questions.

For v1 folks who were here last fall:

Nucleus will be releasing the results from the DNA tests we did during the week of March 10 (likely on March 10th itself, exact time/day to be confirmed).

We will also set up a global Zoom call (for v1 members only) with a rep from the Nucleus team immediately after results are released so that they can share pro tips on understanding your results and so that we can all reflect on results/implications together (sharing results is, of course, optional as results will obviously may include some private information).

I'm psyched! üß¨

@everyone Balaji just sent an important email about Network School v2.

The TLDR is that Network School v2 is frontier, not fancy. Our goal is to build a startup society that bootstraps other startup societies. And our governance is technodemocracy. 

We have two onboarding Zoom calls to talk through the details including potential testnet cryptoeconomics ‚Äî one at [11:59 PM SGT on Feb 17](https://zoom.us/meeting/register/-zbHSkT1TcepG6fXviiLfA) (Americas, Europe) and another at [1 PM SGT on Feb 18](https://zoom.us/meeting/register/pYuqR_8KTRuYCImensYjxQ) (Asia).

Sign up using the links above for the time slot that works best. We're looking forward to seeing you.

@everyone Thank you all for coming to the first Network School. You were pioneers, and helped build something great. In due course, we'll post a recap and an update on v2. For now, please enjoy a very Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!

Here's the tank top for the top NS Burners in the 30 day sprint üôÇ  Thanks to @undefined @undefined @undefined @undefined and everyone for their effort here!
Scroll all the way down to ns.com/profile to see your personal leaderboard

**NS Burn: Sprint to December 23 **
So far we‚Äôve collected 1788 proof-of-workout NFTs, completed 300+ classes, and had 10 people with very significant before-and-after transformations from NS Burn. Now, for the last 30 days of this Network School cohort, we want to finish strong.

So here‚Äôs what we‚Äôre doing.

1) First, we have a new fitness leaderboard thanks to @undefined. It‚Äôs accessible here (https://ns-burn-ef7091de383b.herokuapp.com) and also at your NS profile. Just log in to ns.com, go to ns.com/profile, and scroll down to see it.

2) Second, you can get a workout buddy to drag you to workouts. Just ping @undefined  and she‚Äôll get you one.

3) Third, we have a limited edition NS Burn tanktop that we‚Äôll be awarding to the people that finish strongest in the next 30 days, starting today. That means the highest rate of NFT completion from Nov 22 to Dec 23 üôÇ

We‚Äôve attached some photos below. Let‚Äôs finish strong!  @everyone

**NS Burn: Meal Plan v2 **

We're rolling out meal plan v2 starting Monday (Oct 21):

1) **Weekly subscription model.** We've transitioned to a weekly meal plan subscription priced at $175, running from Monday to Sunday. This promotes a default healthy lifestyle by providing consistent access to nutritious, Blueprint-compatible food for all your meals and supports your fitness goals by taking out the hassle of daily decisions.

2) **From fridge to fresh.** We've updated the meal plan to offer hot boxed lunches and hot catered dinners, replacing some of the previous refrigerated grab-and-go options. The daily menu includes a nutty pudding at 10:30am, a hot lunch at 12pm, and a hot dinner at 6pm.

Subscribe at https://ns.com/food for next week's meal plan by 12pm on Sunday (Oct 20) and get your meal plan wristband from @undefined at 5pm at the gold desk outside NS Club 13.

Before the meal plan v2 kicks off on Monday, use https://ns.com/food-v1 to buy food from NS Cafe 13.

**TRAINERS BACK ON SUNDAY! Gym is now open 7 days per week.**
Ok folks, the trainers are back on Sunday (9/29) and will be back every day going forward. Just like the internet or the roads, our gyms are open seven days per week. Because many people really do want that daily workout, including me.

But wait. What about rest days? What about people who are sore?!? Well, the key concept here is _maximum sustainable intensity_. Here are your options each morning:

1) Feeling good? Go to gym3 for a high intensity workout.
2) Feeling a bit sore? Go to gym1 for a low intensity workout.
3) Feeling sick, or very sore, or injured? Take a rest day for yourself.

That is: health is incredibly personalized. It's not true that everyone needs the same amount of rest days. It's just like work: some people can only work 40 hours per week and others can do 80. Similarly, some people are out of shape and can only tolerate 3 workouts/week at first, while others want 7 days/week. So, if you really need a rest day, of course you should take it, but that doesn't mean the gyms shut down. It's just like the internet ‚Äî if you need to log off, you can, but that doesn't mean the internet shuts down.

*Gym1: low intensity workouts*
I mentioned low intensity workouts in gym1. How does that work? Well, we will soon turn gym1 into a lower intensity workout studio for yoga, stretching, and mobility with classes from Cloudfit. And of course you can also do a gym3 workout with lower weights, or lower speed, thereby dialing back the level of intensity as you see fit.

But of course it's easy to dial intensity down to zero. That's the default in the outside world. What's more interesting is an environment where you can maintain _maximum sustainable intensity_. That's what we're building here. And so the gyms will be open 7 days a week, and the trainers will be present, so that those who prefer an intense daily morning workout will be able to get it. üí™ üëü

PS: Go book your slot at https://cal.com/networkschool if you haven't. See you tomorrow üôÇ

**Dinner will be served at 7pm for just $7**

We heard loud and that NS members loved the catered dinner on Monday so we're planning for more frequent dinners. 

These dinners not only provide a change from the grab-and-go refrigerated meals but also facilitate community bonding. Very importantly, they offer willingness-as-a-service by making the healthy the default option. 

That being said, we're still working on the communal kitchen space and updated meal plans that feature catered dinners. It's time for a v2 ns.com/food and it's coming soon.

The food will be prepared by CGB (the team that served dinner on Monday) and features quinoa, curry turmeric cauliflower, saut√©ed mushrooms, almond flakes, sunflower seeds, marinara dressing, and a choice of parsley garlic chicken thigh or chickpea curry. @everyone

**BROADCAST, CONNECT, RECRUIT**

We've received questions from people that are wondering how to represent Network School on social media. Here's a good framework to follow.

1) *Broadcast*: Share stories and insights from your Network School journey

2) *Connect*: Engage with fellow members and other netizens to expand your network 

3) *Recruit*: Invite passionate, aligned individuals to join our mission to build Silicon Valley without San Francisco

Note: Don't post anything that reflects negatively on other NS members or yourself. And don't dox or post about other members without their consent. @everyone

The Network School kicks off in just 60 hours ‚è≤Ô∏è Here's day 1 schedule by the hour for our official kickoff:

- 7:00pm: Return to NS Cafe (Marina Hotel ‚Äî Floor 13)
- 7:30pm: Enjoy Blueprint dinner
